article.Heading: Budget 2017: Find out how much tax super rich pay in India and elsewhere
article.Summary: The best tax systems are those where the richest pay the highest rates of tax. In India, those with an annual taxable income of more than Rs 1 crore pay an effective tax rate of 35.6 percent.
article.Body:
As Finance Minister Arun Jaitley prepares to present his Union Budget for 2017-18, everyone will want to know where income taxes are headed – more down than up. While the common man won’t complain if the exemption limit isn’t raised beyond the Rs 2,50,000 level, the wealthy will be happier if there is a reduction.

So, what does it mean to be “super-rich”? It depends on which country you belong to.

The best tax systems are those where the richest pay the highest rates of tax. In India, those with an annual taxable income of more than Rs 1 crore pay an effective tax rate of 35.6 percent.

It is a different matter that only 48,000 people have disclosed an annual income of more than Rs 1 crore, signifying thousands continue to dodge taxmen. There is mismatch between many Indians’ spending abilities and disclosed income.

The wealthy in Spain pay a hefty tax of 52 percent on income of USD 3,94,390. 

In 2013-14, the then Finance Minister P Chidambaram levied a surcharge of 10 percent on Rs 1 crore income and above.

Later, Jaitley hiked it to 12 percent in 2015 and still further to 15 percent in 2016.
